cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico and 255 mi ESE of Grand Turk Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW across the Turks & Caicos and the Bahamas, then bending northwest toward south Florida and up the Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida (near the Florida Keys/Everglades region)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast from the Keys northward through Cape Canaveral and adjacent Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: Very high likelihood (40-45%) of hurricane-force winds with tropical-storm-force winds probability up to 90%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft surge along the southeast Florida coast including Port Everglades, especially if the eye passes just west of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–10 inches of rain possible, locally higher, causing flash-flood risk in the Fort Lauderdale metro area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands
